alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 9:40PM MDT until July 20 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 940 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Sevenmile Creek, Coon Creek, Currie Creek, Lake Creek, South Fork Republican River, Gordon Creek, Folger Gulch, North Rush Creek, Hell Creek, Middlemist Creek, North Fork Arikaree River, Vega Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Dugout Creek and Long Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Limon, Hugo, Arriba and Genoa.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
